Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a gRPC server in Go that handles unary RPC calls with ORCA (Open Request Cost Aggregation) metrics recording capabilities.

Struct Description: The server struct implements the gRPC service interface (generated from the protobuf definition) and includes ORCA metrics recording functionality.

Fields:
- UnimplementedEchoServer: [pb.UnimplementedEchoServer] - Embedded type to satisfy the gRPC service interface requirements

Methods:
- UnaryEcho: [Name](ctx context.Context, in *pb.EchoRequest) -> (*pb.EchoResponse, error) - Handles unary RPC calls, records request costs using ORCA metrics, and returns an echo response
- main: [Name]() -> None - Sets up the gRPC server, registers the service, configures ORCA metrics reporting, and starts the server

Input Parameters for UnaryEcho:
- ctx: [context.Context] - Context containing call information and ORCA metrics recorder
- in: [*pb.EchoRequest] - Incoming request message containing the message to echo

Output for UnaryEcho:
- [*pb.EchoResponse] - Response message containing the echoed message
- [error] - Potential error during processing

Note: The main function doesn't have explicit input/output but performs server setup and execution.
